items.name: 2rebase <base>
items.definition: Rebase the current branch onto <base>. <base> can be a commit ID, branch name, a tag, or a relative reference to HEAD

items.name: cherry-pick <commit>
items.definition: Cherry picking is the act of picking a commit from a branch and applying it to another

items.name: revert <commit>
items.definition: Create new commit that undoes all of the changes made in <commit>, then apply it to the current branch

items.name: reset <file>
items.definition: Remove <file> from the staging area, but leave the working directory unchanged. This unstages a file without overwriting any changes

items.name: commit --amend
items.definition: Option --amend allows take the most recent commit and add new staged changes to it

items.name: polyfill
items.definition: A polyfill is a piece of code (usually JavaScript on the Web) used to provide modern functionality on older browsers that do not natively support it

items.name: property descriptor
items.definition: A property descriptor is a record with some of the following attributes: value, writable, get, set, configurable, enumerable

items.name: immutability
items.definition: Immutables are the objects whose state cannot be changed once the object is created. Strings and Numbers are Immutable

items.name: reference
items.definition: The references are pointers to values stored in variables and NOT pointers to other variables, or references

items.name: promise
items.definition: A promise is an object that may produce a single value some time in the future : either a resolved value, or a reason that it's not resolved (e.g., a network error occurred). A promise may be in one of 3 possible states: fulfilled, rejected, or pending

items.name: callback
items.definition: Callback is a function which is to be executed after another function has finished execution
